intro: Daviesia mimosoides subsp. acris, commonly known as the slender sickle-pea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruit and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
